New Records: Gerardo Arteaga scored the only goal of the night in the 69th minute to give Mexico a 1-0 victory over Jamaica, marking a new record for the team's Copa América performance.
Key Match Events: Gerardo Arteaga gave Mexico the advantage on the team's 17th shot of the game, sending one right past Jamaica's keeper to take a 1-0 lead.
A VAR decision determined Jamaica's Michail Antonio was offside after he delivered a beautiful header into the back of the net.
Mexico had yet another opportunity to secure its first score of the game, but failed to convert on Cesar Montes' corner kick.
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: There are no post-match reflections mentioned in the article.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mexico's Edson Álvarez was subbed out with an injury, and replaced by midfielder Luis Romo just before the half hour mark of the match.
Mexico came out swinging in the first half, taking multiple shots at the Jamaica goal, including one that was skillfully saved by a sliding Dexter Lembikisa.
Others: The match was played at NRG Stadium in Houston, Texas.
